pullRequest.title: Support cachable flag in CachingDirectoryLister
pullRequest.bodyText:
This could provide more flexibility on whether a query should use
cache or not. For example, we might not want ingestion query to
pollute cache, and only want cache to serve latency sensitive
queries.
== NO RELEASE NOTE ==

Depended by https://github.com/facebookexternal/presto-facebook/pull/986

commit.message: Use java util Supplier in BackgroundHiveSplitLoader
Use functional style for Optional handling

beforeCommit.message:
Support cachable flag in CachingDirectoryLister

This could provide more flexibility on whether a query should use
cache or not. For example, we might not want ingestion query to
pollute cache, and only want cache to serve latency sensitive
queries.

afterCommit.message:
Support cachable flag in CachingDirectoryLister

This could provide more flexibility on whether a query should use
cache or not. For example, we might not want ingestion query to
pollute cache, and only want cache to serve latency sensitive
queries.

nodes.bodyText: Do we wanna set the default value based on hiveClientConfig.getFileStatusCacheExpireAfterWrite/getFileStatusCacheMaxSize/getFileStatusCacheTables?
nodes.diffHunk:

+                booleanProperty(

nodes.bodyText: nit: I find cacheable too generic, may be specify its for listDirectoryCache?

beforeCommit.message:
Support cachable flag in CachingDirectoryLister

This could provide more flexibility on whether a query should use
cache or not. For example, we might not want ingestion query to
pollute cache, and only want cache to serve latency sensitive
queries.

afterCommit.message:
Support cachable flag in CachingDirectoryLister

This could provide more flexibility on whether a query should use
cache or not. For example, we might not want ingestion query to
pollute cache, and only want cache to serve latency sensitive
queries.
